definition: to hack/to chop/to split open/(of lightning) to strike
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
lit. splitting the head and covering the face (idiom); fig. pelting (with rain etc)/showering down
to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
(onom.) for crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
the splits (move in dancing)/to do the splits/Taiwan pr. [pi3 cha1]
variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
with a lightning move of the hand
to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]

sentences.english: Now the first bolt of lightning stabs the earth .

sentences.english: So the Woodman seized his axe, and with one stroke cut the Serpent in cno.

sentences.english: The northern ice cap on Mars is nearly divided into two by a huge division named Chasma Boreale.

sentences.english: This bookcase is so old and useless that you might as well chop it up for firewood .

sentences.english: The old tree behind our house was riven by lightning last night.

definition: to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to chop/to cut down/to throw sth at sb
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
hand formed into a flat shape, as for a karate chop
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
coming right into one's face/imminent/to put first
to hit with a piercing blow
